intro: Sphaeranthus nubicus, commonly known as the cloudless thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. Sphaeranthus nubicus is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often thriving in sandy or rocky soils.
